commits.message:
♻️ Refactor release process for improved simplicity

Simplify execute_steps method in ReleaseManager class

- Remove Progress bar and related imports
- Streamline step execution logic
- Maintain existing functionality with cleaner code
- Improve readability and reduce complexity
- Keep error handling and rollback mechanisms intact

♻️ Refactor step classes to use CosmosysContext

Refactor release step classes to use CosmosysContext

This commit updates all release step classes to use the new
CosmosysContext object instead of the previous CosmosysConfig.
The change improves consistency and provides better access to
shared resources across steps.

- Update import statements in all step files
- Modify __init__ methods to accept CosmosysContext
- Replace self.config with self.context where appropriate
- Update logging calls to use self.console methods
- Add or improve docstrings for execute() and rollback() methods
- Minor code style improvements and formatting changes

✨ Enhance version update functionality

Improve version update step with robust file handling

- Add support for semver versioning
- Implement file-specific version updates (TOML, JSON, Python)
- Introduce interactive version selection
- Add Git tag creation option
- Improve error handling and user feedback
- Update related components for compatibility

✨ Add VersionManager for improved version handling

Introduce VersionManager class for centralized version management

- Create new version_manager.py with VersionManager class
- Refactor version update logic from VersionUpdateStep
- Implement methods for determining new version and updating files
- Update CLI and VersionUpdateStep to use VersionManager
- Improve version update process with more robust file handling

payload.description: Accelerate your Git workflow with AI

commits.message: :rocket: Release version 0.8.0

⬆️ Upgrade artifact actions to v4

Update upload and download artifact actions

This commit upgrades the artifact-related GitHub Actions to v4:

- Modify 'actions/upload-artifact' to use version 4
- Update 'actions/download-artifact' to version 4

These updates ensure we're using the latest features and
improvements in the artifact handling actions, potentially
enhancing our CI/CD pipeline performance and reliability.
:rocket: Release version 0.8.0

commits.message: :rocket: Release version 0.8.0

⬆️ Update download-artifact action to v4

Upgrade GitHub Actions workflow dependency

This commit updates the download-artifact action in our CI/CD
workflow to version 4. This upgrade ensures we're using the
latest features and improvements provided by the action.

The change helps keep our workflow up-to-date and potentially
improves the efficiency of our artifact downloading process.

payload.description: Accelerate your Git workflow with AI

commits.message: :rocket: Release version 0.8.0

📝 Update TODO list

Revise project tasks and priorities

This commit updates the TODO.md file to reflect current project
status and priorities:

- Add optional confirmation dialogs before commit and on exit
- Remove completed task for conventional commits support
- Remove task for ensuring test provider invisibility
- Add new task for pull request generator
- Remove task for harsh code review optimization
- Remove task for improving error handling

These changes help align the TODO list with recent project
developments and shifting priorities.

♻ ️ Refactor commit message generation process

Improve commit message generation workflow and instructions

This change enhances the commit message generation process to provide
users with more accurate and consistent results:

- Move combined instructions before gitmoji list in system prompt
- Update prompt to emphasize adherence to all provided instructions
- Relocate schema string to end of prompt for better readability

These improvements ensure that AI-generated commit messages better
follow user-defined instructions and maintain consistency with the
project's commit message style guidelines.

🐛 Fix parent commit handling in analyze_commit

Improve robustness of parent commit handling in analyze_commit

Update the logic to properly handle commits without parents:
- Check if commit has parents before attempting to access them
- Use Option for parent commit to handle cases with no parents
- Update tree diff to use the new parent option structure

This change prevents potential panics when analyzing commits
without parent commits, such as the initial commit in a repository.

✨ Enhance issue and PR extraction in ChangeAnalyzer

Improve regex patterns for issue and PR detection

Updates in extract_associated_issues and extract_pull_request:
- Expand issue regex to match both '#' and 'GH-' prefixes
- Broaden PR regex to capture 'pull request' and 'PR' variations
- Standardize output format for consistency

These changes increase the robustness of our change analysis,
ensuring more accurate tracking of related issues and PRs.

✨ feat(presets): Add Conventional Commits preset

Add new instruction preset for Conventional Commits format

This change introduces a new preset to the InstructionPresetLibrary:
- Preset key: "conventional"
- Name: "Conventional Commits"
- Description: "Follow the Conventional Commits specification"
- Includes detailed instructions for formatting commit messages
- Uses 📏 emoji to represent the structured nature of the format

This addition allows users to easily adopt the Conventional Commits
standard, improving consistency and readability of commit messages.

🐛 Fix gradient application for empty or single-char texts

Enhance robustness of apply_gradient function

This change improves the handling of edge cases in the apply_gradient
function:

- Add early return for empty input text or gradient
- Handle single-character texts by using the first gradient color
- Refactor index calculation for better clarity and correctness

These updates prevent potential panics or incorrect color application
when processing empty or very short texts, ensuring a more stable and
reliable UI experience.

♻ ️ Refactor commit message generation process

Improve commit message generation workflow and instructions

This change enhances the commit message generation process to provide
users with more accurate and consistent results:

- Move combined instructions before gitmoji list in system prompt
- Update prompt to emphasize adherence to all provided instructions
- Relocate schema string to end of prompt for better readability

These improvements ensure that AI-generated commit messages better
follow user-defined instructions and maintain consistency with the
project's commit message style guidelines.

📝 Update README with new features and use cases

Revise README to highlight key features and practical applications

Enhancements include:
- Reorganize structure for better readability
- Add 'Key Features' section emphasizing core capabilities
- Include 'Getting Started' with simplified installation instructions
- Expand 'Usage' section with basic command examples
- Add 'Advanced Topics' covering configuration and remote structure
- Introduce 'Use Cases' section with practical backup scenarios
- Update development and contribution guidelines

These changes provide a more comprehensive and user-friendly overview
of AeonSync's capabilities and potential applications.

✨ Add daily backup option and sequence numbering

Implement daily backup option and sequence numbering for backups

In backup.py:
- Add daily flag to BackupConfig
- Implement _get_next_backup_name for sequence numbering
- Update backup_name and backup_path generation

In cli.py:
- Add daily option to sync command
- Update config command with default_daily_backup option
- Modify BackupConfig creation to include daily flag

In config.py:
- Add default_daily_backup to default configuration
- Include daily flag in BackupConfig

Update tests to cover new functionality in test_backup.py and test_cli.py

✨ Enhance backup list display and data processing

Refactor ListBackups class for improved functionality and readability

- Revise backup list parsing to handle multi-line JSON data
- Update table columns to show more relevant information
- Implement sorting of backups by date in descending order
- Add methods to extract and format total size and changed size
- Improve file count formatting to display only the total number
- Enhance error handling and logging for JSON parsing errors
- Remove unused imports and simplify code structure

These changes provide a more informative and user-friendly backup list
display, focusing on key metrics like total size and changed size.

🐛 Fix incremental backup link-dest path

Update relative path for incremental backups

Modify the --link-dest argument in the rsync command to use
"../latest" instead of "../{HOSTNAME}/latest". This change
ensures correct reference to the previous backup for
incremental backups, fixing potential issues with hardlinking.

issue.title: Card not showing up in card list
issue.body:
Firstly, thanks for this and the integration project. Amazing work, I can tell a lot of effort went in. I actually tried to do this same thing before the local API with a local rust proxy of the Application URI's and registry watching like a year ago! Still got the old screen cap lying around https://streamable.com/is2n3o. Eventually, my choice of rust ground me down and I started regretting not just using node and I never saw it through 😅.

I have an odd problem where the card is not showing up in the card list. Obviously, I suspect this is a me problem on my setup, but I'm out of ideas and hoping you might have some. The dev tools console reports the card is loaded successfully, but when I go to add the card, its simply not in the list (other custom cards working).

HASS 2024.8.3, installed through latest HACS (btw total side point but in the very recent latest hacs they totally changed the UI including how to add new stuff so the readme's might need a tweak).

I have cleared all site data via dev tools so it seems like it's not a caching issue. Tried restarting hass, logging in and out etc.
